body: Planes come in a variety of sizes and shapes. Most planes are infinite, or at least so large that they may as well be infinite.
name: Shape and Size
url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Planar Adventures/Planar Traits/Shape and Size

sections.body: Planes with this trait go on forever, though they may have finite components within them. Alternatively, they may consist of ongoing expanses in two directions, like a map that stretches out infinitely. Unless otherwise noted in its description, assume that a plane is effectively infinite.
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Planar Adventures/Planar Traits/Shape and Size/Infinite
sections.name: Infinite

sections.body: A plane with this trait has defined edges or borders. These borders may adjoin other planes or be hard, finite borders such as the edge of the world or a great wall. Demiplanes are often finite.
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Planar Adventures/Planar Traits/Shape and Size/Finite Shape
sections.name: Finite Shape

sections.body: On planes with this trait, the borders wrap in on themselves, depositing the traveler on the other side of the map. Some spherical planes are examples of self-contained, finite planes, but they can also be cubes, tori, or flat expanses with magical edges that teleport the traveler to the opposite edge when she crosses them. Some demiplanes are self-contained.
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Planar Adventures/Planar Traits/Shape and Size/Self-Contained Shape
sections.name: Self-Contained Shape
